Talk00:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Chat_01>I think I've narrowed down where those
<clr:0000>old manuscripts<clr:ffff> could be referring to.<sp:5:1:0>
Yeah, I'm sure of it!
Talk18:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Pleasure doing business with you!


<sp:3:0:2:0701>Trust me, that was a steal. If you find the
treasure, it'll be worth way more than a
measly <clr:0000>100 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Talk01: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Way to go, Dak! You're a genius!<sp:5:1:0>
Talk42:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Listen, you! That's the last morsel of
information you're getting out of us!
Talk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Oh, come on!<sp:5:0:0> Can't we have one brotherly
conversation without you listening in?!
Talk43:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What is it? <sp:5:0:0>We already told you all the
old manuscripts had to say.
Talk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Yeah! <sp:5:0:0>We're not gonna tell you one word
about <clr:0000>the bandit Misko's old manuscripts<clr:ffff>!
Talk44: <sp:3:0:2:0000>Wait, are you wearing the treasure now?
Talk46:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I admit, that kind of stings, but...so be it.
There are other treasures out there.
Talk07: <sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_01>I did it again, didn't I?<sp:5:0:0> Sorry, Dak...<sp:5:1:0>
Talk30:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We've got your money, so we'll tell you as
many times as you want. <clr:0000>Which of the
manuscripts<clr:ffff> would you like to hear?
Talk08:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Eh, it's fine. <sp:5:0:0>The treasure's as good as
ours, and this guy'd never work out these
riddles, even if we told him.
Talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:LaughS>Thing is, I'm not about to give that info up
for free. <sp:5:1:0>It'll run you <clr:0000>100 rupees<clr:ffff>.
Talk33:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Did you already solve the riddle from the
first old manuscript? You only get one at
a time, that's the rule!
<sp:3:0:2:0801>We've already solved both of these other
ones, haven't we, Dak?
Talk34:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Naturally.<sp:5:0:0> There's no riddle that can't be
solved once it falls into my hands.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>The one I gave you was pretty easy,
though. If you think long and hard about
it, you might be able to figure it out!
Talk35:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Not gonna lie, this one's a real doozy
of a riddle. It's hard to solve from the
manuscript alone.
But I'll tell you the answer, if you want!
Talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_01>What is it? <sp:5:0:0>Want me to tell you <clr:0000>what the
old manuscripts said<clr:ffff>, after all?
Talk38:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>You really mean it? Never thought you'd
go and find it before we did...
Talk21:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_01>What is it? <sp:5:0:0>Want me to tell you <clr:0000>what
another manuscript said<clr:ffff>?

Or do you want me to refresh your
memory on one you've already heard?
Talk39:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Yeah, and we'll get the next one!
You'll see!
Talk22:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>I bet your head's really spinning after all
that. An amateur like you probably has no
idea where to even begin!
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Good thing we've already puzzled
everything out, right, Dak?
Talk23:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughL_00>I mean, you're welcome to try putting
your little rookie brain to the test...

<sp:3:0:2:0801>But we've got those treasures in the bag!
Talk26:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>There are <clr:0000>three <clr:ffff>manuscripts. Which do
you want to hear?
Talk27:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You're back? <sp:5:0:0>We already told you what all
the old manuscripts had to say.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Oh, I get it. You forgot, huh? Well, fine.
Pay attention and I'll tell you again.

<sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:0000>Which of the old manuscripts <clr:ffff>did you want
to hear?
Talk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Well, look at this guy! He thinks he can
find the treasure without the manuscripts.
Yeah, good luck with that.
Talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Hey, buddy! <sp:5:0:0>Want me to tell you what the
<clr:0000>manuscripts said<clr:ffff>?
Talk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>You know the deal. It's <clr:0000>100 rupees <clr:ffff>per
manuscript. Cough 'em up.
Talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>All right, then. *ahem*


"I discovered the green clothes of a man
who admired fairies and have hidden them
away. Solve my riddle to find them anew.
"In West Necluda stand twins poised to
duel. Each contains a cavern that faces
the other.
"Show the little twin's sign to the big twin
to open the door to my treasure."

<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's what it says.
Talk14:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Come on, don't be so stingy! This info's
so choice, it'd be a crime to let it go for
anything cheaper!
Talk15:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>What are you trying to pull here? You
don't have the money! I'm not letting
this info slip until you do.
Talk16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>OK, listen up and focus.


"I discovered the green clothes of a man
who admired fairies and have hidden them
away. Solve my riddle to find them anew.
"Statues of the eight heroines reside in
the desert. Enter the valley carved into
Hemaar's Descent...
"and shine the light of day upon the
towering eighth. The path to the
treasure will open before you."
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The end.
Talk17:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sure thing. Listen close.


"I discovered the green clothes of a man
who admired fairies and have hidden them
away. Solve my riddle to find them anew.
"A forgotten pirate cavern lurks at the
foot of Cape Cales, overlooking the
Necluda Sea.
"The short, shrill song of wind through
lips will open the way to my treasure."
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's it.
